get_summary_stats

Source: R/utils.R
get_summary_stats.Rd

Compute all relevant summary statistics given a dataframes of all numerical columns.

Usage

get_summary_stats(data)

Arguments

data

a dataframe

Value

a dataframe

Examples

X <- sim_clust(2, 100, dmin = 0.5, rmin = 0.3, nind = 10)
get_summary_stats(X)
#>                  x1         x2         x3         x4         x5         x6
#> mean      0.1682409 -0.4040130  0.1352947 -0.5121637  0.1857525 -0.4615449
#> sd        1.0041404  1.0014558  1.0625789  1.1978689  1.0508353  1.0864968
#> min      -2.4441562 -2.6577464 -2.5328958 -2.8663350 -3.2401420 -3.1441381
#> max       2.0214983  1.6104838  3.6438712  2.0547329  2.5599693  2.2893938
#> skewness -0.0874203 -0.2611689  0.2339994  0.0455060 -0.4098007  0.1303589
#> kurtosi  -0.5932045 -0.5295454  0.4232866 -1.0009107  0.1577832 -0.3297165
#> q25      -0.5256486 -1.1089864 -0.4945285 -1.5019902 -0.6395774 -1.2264129
#> q50       0.1276540 -0.3514317  0.1816226 -0.5104905  0.2823469 -0.5467770
#> q75       0.8657621  0.2910405  0.8034076  0.3660634  0.8919663  0.3767416
#>                  x7           x8         x9         x10      group
#> mean     -0.2728314  0.072561126  0.1420509 -0.27449530  1.5000000
#> sd        1.0625625  1.161773234  1.0881075  1.00990976  0.5025189
#> min      -3.2837781 -3.200246835 -2.1210246 -3.08459948  1.0000000
#> max       2.3796649  3.695798344  2.2954721  2.25635819  2.0000000
#> skewness -0.3379429  0.131536095 -0.1754321 -0.05563565  0.0000000
#> kurtosi   0.1775624  0.222682355 -0.8357194 -0.15310581 -2.0199000
#> q25      -0.8812727 -0.702358555 -0.6570963 -0.92307705  1.0000000
#> q50      -0.1637824 -0.001962071  0.2090177 -0.26287552  1.5000000
#> q75       0.3350277  0.796574473  0.9233833  0.38018196  2.0000000
